medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden-onset abdominal pain in the right lower quadrant (RLQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced sudden abdominal pain in the RLQ approximately 35 hours prior to admission. The pain has persisted since yesterday, is non-radiating, and worsens with standing and walking. He has had chills, nausea, and one episode of vomiting. Diarrhea occurred prior to the onset of pain but has resolved. The patient took Advil for pain the night prior to admission.
